caption.p: Percent area of the contiguous U.S. classified based on combinations of the degree of climate exposure (vulnerability) and conservation value for three multivariate metrics (i.e., the “corners” of the conceptual model and mapping legend).

tr.td: Low conservation value, low climate vulnerability
Low conservation value, high climate vulnerability
High conservation value, low climate vulnerability
High conservation value, high climate vulnerability

table-wrap-foot.p: Lands are mapped in Fig. 4 and the left column of Fig. 5. Percent area is reported here for easier evaluation of geographic patterns in classification. Figure 6 shows how these values change when assessing agreement in climate simulations.
